industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
About Us:

At CompassX, our clients rely on us to lead high-priority strategic initiatives and transformational projects. Our mission is to create a community of people who come up with innovative approaches and deliver the best outcomes for our clients.

You will have the opportunity to leverage your experience, creativity, and skills to impact your clients and influence the trajectory of our firm to achieve growth for the team and your career.

We are honored to be recognized as a “Best Place to Work” in Southern California and listed as one of INC.’s 5000 fastest-growing private companies in the U.S.

Location: Serving our clients in Los Angeles, Orange, San Diego, and Ventura counties (Hybrid)

Role Description:

You will be responsible for process design, gathering requirements, leading client workshops, creating a roadmap, prioritizing backlogs, and working with technical teams to materialize the product vision. In your position on the engagement, you will be setting the direction for the product and be a key point of contact for the client. As you develop your relationships, you will have the opportunity to grow our presence on the account and bring value to the client.

Also, as a valued member of the company, we would invite you to contribute to the growth of the firm. Your participation could be on the account, practice areas, recruiting, mentoring, or internal initiatives.

We look for our Senior Consultants to have several of the following:


  • 2+ years performing in a business/system analyst or product owner role
  • 4+ years of total experience
  • 2+ yrs with a premier consulting firm
  • Experience on fast-paced, complex projects
  • Work with client stakeholders to draw out Product Vision
  • Experience documenting requirements, process flows, and user stories
  • Able to translate business requirements for developers
  • Clarifiy details and articulate acceptance criteria for testing purposes
  • Participate in system requirements, design, construction, testing, and deployment
  • Hands-on approach to client delivery and detail-orientedExperience working in the Agile methodology (e.g., planning/running sprints, backlog prioritization, retrospectives, and leading scrum teams)
  • Technology implementation experience (e.g., data, ERP, CRM, Cloud-based Apps, e-Commerce, or other digital)
  • Process mapping, re-engineering, and optimization experience
  • Organizational change management or user adoption experience
  • Ability to win project extensions and reassignments by building strong client relationships




You'll fit right in if you are a:


  • You provide an excellent customer experience through your client interactions and deliverables
  • You are excited for growth and open to change
  • You are deeply interested in being a team player and building relationships
  • You are proactive in taking on responsibilities and accountability
  • You are dedicated and driven towards achieving goals




Benefits

  • Competitive base salary plus a generous upside variable compensation model
  • Annual performance reviews that are straightforward and transparent
  • PTO plus holidays plus sick time
  • Sabbatical program
  • Health, dental, vision, term life, AD&D
  • Retirement plan with company matching
  • Continuous education investments to grow your skills & knowledge
  • Small firm feel and direct relationships with the Executive Leadership Team
  • Opportunity to design and build a firm
  • Remote working options
  • Opportunity to build a professional network in your own community
